content.question: Which of the following expressions gives the length of the curve <math alttext="y equals, e raised to the 3 x power " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> from <math alttext="x equals negative 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="x equals 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 2, of, the square root of 1 plus, e raised to the 3 x power, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 2, of, the square root of 1 plus, 3 times e raised to the 3 x power, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 2, of, the square root of 1 plus, e raised to the 6 x power, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 2, of, the square root of 1 plus, 9 times e raised to the 6 x power, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 2, of, the square root of 1 plus, 9 times e raised to the 6 x power, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.13: (BC ONLY) The Arc Length of a Smooth, Planar Curve and Distance Traveled

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
